column4: vlc gives me "(no video)" when trying to view an avi divx. why is this? should i try mplayer instead?
do you know why it does that though?
there are a lot of possible reasons.
is mplayer generaly a safer bet?
tell me when youve actually tried mplayer
i had the problem before on another pc
wait, wait, you said DIVX AVI?
i had resolved it but cant remember how and it was with quicktime instead of divx
its nearly worked! i shall remember in future: vlc<mplayer, all i have to do know i think is un install totem because it gives me a message about totem being unable to play the file
sorry for not checking my #ubuntu messages. I was helping someone in #amsn
